history.content: It varies quite a bit by different companies. The one I have worked for and sharing my experience on this post is referring to the large software company based in Redmond, Washington. Program Managers task can varies on a day to day basis. If you are at the starting phase of a project, you will be most likely working on ideation, user research, features research etc. along with making simple designs (and you will work with UI/UX Designers for more specific ones). Many companies follow the agile methodology, so you will take a decent amount of time revising your designs and features of your product or project. Throughout this time, you will be responsible for a detailed spec recording what need to be build, why (based on research), the specific details of each features and designs etc. This massive spec will be then used for software engineers and designers as well as for program managers to guide and build this product. As a program manager, you will be unblocking for the team of whatever anyone is facing and constantly updating this spec if certain things don’t work out. You will be working  with software engineers to ensure this project is finishing in time etc. And your team might continuously to push updates and monitor the project after its being release (all depending on the situations). That’s a brief overview of program managers role. I hope that was helpful. And above is for program management. There might be slight different with product management, and it also varies by companies.

Throughout this time, you will be responsible for a detailed spec recording what need to be build, why (based on research), the specific details of each features and designs etc. This massive spec will be then used for software engineers and designers as well as for program managers to guide and build this product. As a program manager, you will be unblocking for the team of whatever anyone is facing and constantly updating this spec if certain things don’t work out. You will be working  with software engineers to ensure this project is finishing in time etc. And your team might continuously to push updates and monitor the project after its being release (all depending on the situations). That’s a brief overview of program managers role. I hope that was helpful.

Hey has anyone here gone into a PM internship or PM full time? I was maybe thinking going down the PM route but I’m not sure how it is in terms of pay/interesting work compared to data science or start up software roles. I have a software internship under my belt and it’s not that appealing to me, maybe it’s because I worked at a big company where there wasn’t much interesting work to do. I’ve always wanted to go into management of some sort and idk what exactly PM does
history.subject: Product Management
